newsitem.title: URUGUAY: World firms compete for Uruguay telecom tower.
newsitem.headline: World firms compete for Uruguay telecom tower.

text.p: Ten international construction consortiums have presented competing proposals to build a major telecommunications tower for Uruguay's state telephone company Antel in Montevideo, the firm said Thursday.
Antel will decide January 14 which bidders will be invited to participate in the second half of the tender and submit economic proposals, Antelco said.
Antelco received bids from the United States, Germany, France, Spain, Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay to build the tower, which Antelco sources said should cost $40-45 million.
Antelco plans to award the contract March 8 and the tower should be built within 18 months.
